body:
Thanks for the report. Could you try the following?

Select a js response (from the History tab or something) that doesn't cause the issue. Right click in the response body area, goto syntax and disabled 'Syntax highlighting' and 'Wordwrap', then go back to the item that's causing the problem. 

Does that alleviate the issue?

I don't see the ability to disable Syntax Highlighting through the Syntax menu.  Only see Auto Detect, Plain, CSS, HTML, JavaScript, JSON, XML.  I changed it from Autodetect/JavaScript to Plain, but it only applies to that one JS response.  Is there another way to disable application wide (not seeing it in Options)?

Sorry yes, I wasn't specific enough. Once you disable Auto Detect, set PlainText, and disable Wordwrap it should apply until you change it again.

This animated gif is far from perfect but hopefully it's 'good enough'.

![view_contexts](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7570458/72006916-9ea14c00-321e-11ea-9668-d220365ff07a.gif)
Issue still occurs.  No other JS files are causing the issue and I do see warnings on those about large file sizes.  Found some in History, and in other Alerts != Application Error Disclosure.
Can you navigate to one of the URLs in the browser and send us the content? (Assuming it's sufficiently generic/non-sensitive.)
Unfortuntately it has lots of information in it and I can't send.  I can tell you it's a 2MB webpack looking file :)
I'm 90% sure it's the issue I'm thinking, unfortunately I have no way of knowing that you're getting things turned off as expected or recreating it locally.....
After further review, you are correct.  After changing to plain, I can now load them in the Response.
Still moves a little slow, but it does not freeze the app.

Great, thanks for letting us know!

Is it one (or a number of) giant long lines?
Okay so it's probably actually Wordwrap that's the issue not syntax highlighting.

rename.from: Alerts - Application Error Disclosure - JS file causes app to freeze.
rename.to: JS file causes app to freeze

body: It appears it may be both?  I've disabled each one individually and the issue appears if Wordwrap or Syntax is enabled, but the other isn't.

rename.from: JS file causes app to freeze
rename.to: Big messages cause GUI to freeze

body: This is not specific to JS files, it can be reproduced with other types that are highlighted or have long line(s).

issue.title: BUG: ZAP 2.9 hangs when walking through the Alerts URLs (large JavaScript)

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When the scan of a very large site is finished and one walks through the Alerts URLS to validate for False Positives. ZAP stops responding completely and doesn't accept any input from the keyboard nor mouse. If one waits about 5 minutes ZAP seems to recover and you can make a single click which then hangs ZAP again for 5 minutes. In ProcMon64 I see that the session receives a .lck extension (guessing this means Lock). 
This also happened when ZAP gave back control and I tried to run a HTML report.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
- Run a giant scan of a huge website returning giant JavaScripts (boostrap)
- When finished walk through the Alerts
- When clicking on one of the giant JavaScript URLS ZAP will go into a kind of LOCK mode and no longer respond to user input.
- Click on Report HTML
- ZAP no longer responds to user input.

**Expected behavior**
- It would be nice if there were some kind of Visual feedback that ZAP was in LOCK mode.
-- This way the user doesn't need to panic and try to shut down ZAP loosing all their scan data.
- It would be nice if the keyboard and mouse interrupted the LOCK mode by stopping the current processing and gave control back to the user.  
-- Lock conditions can be very intimidating for users, especially new users who might feel they broke something. 

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10052587/74362055-44b91680-4dc8-11ea-8080-f1d67a94fc00.png)


**Software versions**
 - ZAP: 2.9
 - Add-on:  Passive Scanning Rules removed for this scan
[2020-02-12_InstalledAddOns_NoPassiveScanning.csv.txt](https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/files/4193958/2020-02-12_InstalledAddOns_NoPassiveScanning.csv.txt)

 - OS: Windows 10 19.09
 - Java:  java -version
openjdk version "13.0.2" 2020-01-15
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 13.0.2+9)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 13.0.2+9, mixed mode, sharing)
 - Browser: Firefox 73

**Errors from the zap.log file**
Sanitized
[2020-02-12_BugLocked_zap.log](https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/files/4193986/2020-02-12_BugLocked_zap.log)


**Additional context**

The screenshot shows .lck and .data when the system is locked I only see .lck and nothing else.

body: Would you like me to repost the Log file from #5862 to this bug?
It's not necessary, the causes are known. Thanks.

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body: I am using 64GB Ram Windows 10 system and I believe it is more than recommended one. I am facing issue everyday whenever I put my web application for active scanning after crawling all web pages. some times during scan when I want to see Alert and scroll down, it hangs. Sometime when I left the system unattended for 24+ hrs and later want to see the status, it hangs. There is  no guarantee of successful scan which is wasting my effort every day. Can some one please help me here ? Do I need to some kind of fine tuning ?

issue.title: Improvements to long searches (cancelling, async, multithreaded, cached)

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
1) On sites with huge .js files the search might take too long and I always have to kill the ZAP because it is unresponsive during long searches. As many modern sites use bundled huge js files, this makes searches unusable and forces me more and more to develop my own ZAP clone without such trivial issues.
2) Search takes only 25% of 4 core CPU.
3) It seems that each huge .js file occurrence is searched again and again. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
1) Search should be fully asynchronous. User should be able to use the UI during search in huge .js webapps.. ZAP should have "stop search" button.
2) Search is multithreaded
3) Huge files are hashed. If DB contains already searched file hash, the search is not performed on the huge file again.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I always have to save my session beforehand searches, then kill the ZAP if it takes too long during searches.

**Additional context**
To reproduce use any web app which loads huge .js files

**Would you like to help implementing this feature?**
I don't know how to code in Java.

Version:
D-2020-06-08 and all previous major versions like 2.9 2.8. 2.7

P.S. The search didn't unhang while I was writing this bug report. I will have to kill the app and lose my whole session (because it wasn't saved before the search).

issue.title: Zap freezes when inspecting Alerts window

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
The Zap UI freezes if I click any expanded content within the **Alerts** window.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run **Attack** in **Standard Mode** on small website running on my local workstation.
2. Scan completes.
3. Click **Alerts** button.  This displays four alerts.
4. Expand one of the nodes by clicking the arrow icon.  This reveals three sub-entries.  UI is still responsive at this point.  I can click other tabs and back to **Alerts**.
5. Select one of the sub-entries.  Details display in right-hand side.  But the entire UI is unresponsive.
6. Perform **force quit** on Zap.

**Expected behavior**
I expected the UI to continue to be responsive.

**Screenshots**
The last thing I see before a freeze.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1967533/51096612-7e0cf600-1772-11e9-9b75-147c9eaf40fe.png)

**Software versions**
 - ZAP: `7.2.0`
 - Add-on: None that I know of.
 - OS: macOS `10.12.6`
 - Java: `1.8.0_65`
 - Browser: Using **QuickStart**.

**Errors from the zap.log file**
I tailed `zap.log` during my navigation into the **Alerts** menu.  No entries are added.  This log seems to grow mostly during a test.

**Additional context**
* CPU utilization for Zap hovers at 100% (out of 400% for a quad-core) during the freeze.
* I **force quit** to stop it.
* Once (out of seven times) the problem didn't immediately happen.  I was able to navigate within the **Alert** panel for about 10 seconds before the UI froze.
* No other Zap panels give me this issue.
* Behavior is the same before and after updating all plugins.
